alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 04 at 6:50PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Wintry mix of precipitation including potential freezing rain through Sunday night... A low pressure system along the Californian Coast continues to bring a mixture of snow and rain to Northern and Central Nevada this early Sunday night. Latest radars is currently seeing showers mostly over the eastern half Elko County where valleys are slowing changing over from rain to snow tonight. As we head into the overnight, chances for pockets of freezing rain become a possibility in the lower elevations. While not much accumulations is expected should it occur, hazardous travel could still result from a small amount of freezing rain on roadways. Make sure to use caution while driving and be weary of bridges and overpasses as they are the most susceptible areas to freezing rain. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
